perturbation.original_text:
§ 7 Agreement period / Cancellation
The term of this Agreement will begin upon acceptance of Affiliate's
Program application and will end when terminated by either party of this
Agreement. This Agreement is entered into for an unlimited period of time.
Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable
settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.changed_text:
§ 7 Agreement period / Cancellation
The term of this Agreement will begin upon acceptance of Affiliate's
Program application and will end when terminated by either party of this
Agreement. This Agreement is entered into for a period of one year, automatically renewing for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the renewal date. Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable
settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated the agreement was for an unlimited period of time and could be cancelled at any time. The changed text introduces a one-year term with automatic renewal, contradicting the initial statement of an unlimited term. This creates uncertainty regarding the duration of the agreement and the conditions for its termination.

perturbation.original_text:
§ 6 Advertising Cost Compensation
(1) element 5 will pay Affiliate its advertising costs (including Vat, if
any, on presentation of a valid VAT invoice) if an end user arrives via the
link integrated in Affiliate's Web site at the order page hosted by element
5 for the respective Software
perturbation.changed_text:
§ 6 Advertising Cost Compensation
(1) element 5 may pay Affiliate its advertising costs (including Vat, if
any, on presentation of a valid VAT invoice) if an end user arrives via the
link integrated in Affiliate's Web site at the order page hosted by element
5 for the respective Software
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated "element 5 will pay Affiliate..." making the payment of advertising costs mandatory. The changed text states "element 5 may pay Affiliate..." which makes the payment of advertising costs discretionary. This introduces a contradiction regarding whether the affiliate is guaranteed to receive advertising costs for generating a lead.

perturbation.original_text:
§ 3 Correspondenceont>
Correspondence shall take place preferably via e-mail, which is accorded
the same status as postal mail. Qualifying dates are always agreed as
"Receipt by Recipient", unless otherwise noted. For e-mail, the receipt of
the message on the destination mail server is deemed to be the time of
reception.
perturbation.changed_text:
§ 3 Correspondenceont>
Correspondence shall take place via certified postal mail only. No other form of communication is permissible. Qualifying dates are always agreed as
"Receipt by Recipient", unless otherwise noted. For certified postal mail, the official delivery date will be used as the time of reception.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated correspondence should preferably occur through email, and defined the conditions for delivery confirmation. The modified text states that all correspondence MUST occur via certified postal mail, contradicting the initial permission of email use, and creating confusion for any correspondence attempts.
